help.title: Welcome to Virtuoso Web Applications
help.para: This is the Virtuoso Web Applications home page. If site-wide registration is enabled you may register yourself and begin using web applications hosted here. After successful login you will be able to create your own application instances and join others.

Some public application instances are shown for you to view and join if the service policy permits. If you are looking for a particular service or service containing particular information you can enter specific criteria in the search box to find any relevant instance.

sect.title: Registration
sect.para: Before you can use this site you must have a suitable login. If the policy of the site permits public registration then you may use the "Register" button to begin registration. For registration you will need an email address. After providing some other details your email address may be used for verification or your details.

sect.title: Login Problems
sect.para: Use of in-correct login details will reveal a button "Forgot your password" that will lead you through your security question to the recovery of your password.

sect.title: Mail Server Settings
sect.para: In order to send confirmation emails you must ensure that this server can send emails. The Virtuoso INI file may contain the setting for the "DefaultMailServer", which can be used or overridden. This default mail setting is shown. Use the checkbox to use the default or specify an alternative.

Emails regarding the default WA site will be sent to the Administrator (DAV); you must ensure the administrators email address is valid. Use the Test button to send the Administrator a test mail. You can change the Administrators email address from here.

sect.title: System Mail Templates
sect.para: These are the mails that the WA will send to its users in response to particular actions. You must enable "verify registration by email" above before any emails will be sent.
The mails support some string-substitutions for personalized emails as follows:

simplelist.member: %app% name of application type in question (weblog, wiki)
%wa_home% the home page of the wa
%app_name% the name of the application instance
%app_url% the preferred url to the application, usually a virtual directory?
%app_action_url% The url for continuing the action
%apps_available% this will be a list of applications available in the format of name, line space, description

help.title: Virtuoso Web Applications Management
help.para: This page will show you what application you own or are a member of, and also other public application instances that you may view or join.
You may search for specific types of application instance or instances with particular information. Depending on the policy of the service you may be able to join.

sect.title: User Profile
sect.para: You may alter you personal or login details using the button provided. You can also change your password.

sect.title: Application Endpoint Administration
sect.para: You may alter the host/domain settings of your applications to provide more convenient URLs to remember them by. You can choose from the site registered domain names or enter one based on your own Internet domain registration if you have one.

sect.title: Applications
sect.para: This section shows details of applications that are hosted on this site. Click on one to create your own application instance of such. Then you can begin using it.

help.title: Creating a New Application Instance
help.para: This page lets you create an instance of the select application type.

sect.title: Instance Name
sect.para: The new name of the instance you are creating. This must be a site-wide unique name so your choice may have already been used. By default your username is appended to the service type name as a suggestion since username are also site-unique.

sect.title: Instance Description
sect.para: This can be any description that you wish to provide for your new instance. It should be as informative as possible especially if this instance is going to visible to the public. This description may be used to provide the public with information about the nature of the instance. It will also be used as search criteria.

sect.title: Member Model
sect.para: This setting refers to the way the public can interact with your new application instance. The options are:

simplelist.member: Open - will allow any member to join your instance without requiring your consent or knowledge. You will be able to see who is a member of instance at any time and revoke memberships but will not receive any join notifications.
Closed - No one will be able to join your instance.
Invitation Only - Only users specifically invited by you will be able to join the instance. Invites are sent to a prospective users email address with a URL to proceed.

Approval Based - Any user may request to join your instance. A notification will be sent to your email address asking you to accept of reject the request of the user. They will not be permitted to complete the join without your approval.

sect.title: Is Public
sect.para: This option defines whether the instance will be available for the public to view. If this option is off then only logged-in members will be able to view the instance. With this option disabled your application instance will not be listed on the Web Applications home page or be obtainable from a public initiated search.

sect.title: Is Members Visible
sect.para: This option restricts access further to "Is Public" but preventing your instance be searchable by its members.
